comments:
At the very end of the run where I had a user of Hyades set to replay a 
recording of going out to http://ejb1.rtp.raleigh.ibm.com/perseus/JavaTest.html 
and then click on DVD players, and then run this one time per minute for 
10000000 times but stop after 3 minutes,  although the RAC on zos did not stop 
and appeared otherwise healthy, and the workbench side did not show any errors,
 the following message appears on zos at the end of the 3 minute run:
  java.nio.BufferUnderflowException
        at java.nio.Buffer.nextGetIndex(Buffer.java:421)
        at java.nio.HeapByteBuffer.getLong(HeapByteBuffer.java:298)
        at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.AbstractFileServerCommand$State.
receiveLong(AbstractFileServ)
        at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.AbstractFileServerCommand$State.
send(AbstractFileServerComma)
        at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.GetFileCommand$Server.execute
(GetFileCommand.java)
        at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.AbstractFileServerCommand.execut
e(AbstractFileServerCommand.)
        at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerImplExtended.r
un(FileClientHandlerImplExte)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:568)

I tried this with the new workbench specially made, for the user of hyades, 
that is uptodate with the RAC used when this bug was reported, and happily 
there was no BUfferUnderflow exception.
I am therefore closing this out.
